artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Impressionism Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

visualCharacteristics: Emphasis on capturing the fleeting visual impression of a moment, especially the effects of light and color
Use of pure, unmixed colors applied side-by-side (optical mixing)
Focus on accurately depicting light, atmosphere, and reflected color (including colored shadows)
Subjects often include modern life, leisure, landscapes, cityscapes, painted outdoors ('en plein air')
Soft edges and less emphasis on precise contours or detailed drawing
Overall feeling of spontaneity, immediacy, and vibrancy
techniques: Oil painting simulation with visible, broken brushstrokes
Optical mixing of adjacent pure colors
Avoidance of black for shadows, using color instead (blues, purples)

colorPalette.description: Bright, luminous palette emphasizing natural light. Features pure, often unmixed colors applied in dabs or strokes. Use of complementary colors placed adjacently for vibrancy. Shadows rendered with blues, violets, and other colors rather than black or grey.
keyColors: Limited or no use of Black

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Distinctive surface texture created by visible, often energetic or dabbed brushstrokes (impasto is common). The texture itself helps convey the shimmering quality of light and the immediacy of the impression.
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Often informal, seemingly spontaneous compositions capturing a snapshot of life. Influenced by photography and Japanese prints, may feature unusual cropping, high or low viewpoints, asymmetrical balance, and open compositions suggesting space beyond the frame.
references: Pierre-Auguste Renoir ('Bal du moulin de la Galette')
Mary Cassatt (Mothers and children, domestic scenes)

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Flat, even, bright lighting with no discernible source or shadows, typical of Egyptian art.
sceneContext.cameraView: Strict profile or composite view, straight-on perspective, avoiding complex angles.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: A stylized representation of a cave interior or outdoor landscape, framed perhaps with simple geometric Egyptian borders or patterns.

avoid: Dynamic, fluid poses (use stiff Egyptian poses)
